alert.note: Alert for Broome; Chemung; Chenango; Cortland; Delaware; Otsego; Schuyler; Steuben; Tioga; Tompkins; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 4:28PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF STEUBEN...OTSEGO...CHEMUNG... CHENANGO...CORTLAND...YATES...SCHUYLER...TIOGA...BROOME...DELAWARE... AND TOMPKINS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of 30 MPH or greater which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. This squall is producing heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 427 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Sharon Springs to near Oxford to near Arkport and moving southeast at 25 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Ithaca, Elmira, Oneonta, Corning, Hornell, Big Flats, Norwich, Horseheads, Bath and Maine. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 6 and 9. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 34 North and 54. Interstate 88 between 5 and 19. Interstate 390 near 1. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Broome; Chemung; Chenango; Cortland; Delaware; Otsego; Schuyler; Steuben; Tioga; Tompkins; Yates
